text: Oh, thank you, that seems very useful. We used a model trained by <https://www.softcatala.org|SoftCatala> (see <https://github.com/Softcatala/nmt-softcatala|here>) that I think is supposed to have a performance similar too the one by Google Translator, but surely having MS Translate suggestions will help curating those automatic translations faster.

attachments.text: This repository contains Neural Machine Translation tools built at Softcatalà

text:
Confirming... there are also 76 .po files already using `X-Generator: Weblate` in svn/trunk

```grep -Fhr "X-Generator" . --include=*.po | awk -F' ' '{print $2}' | sort -u
# Lokalize
# Poedit
# Pootle
# Translate
# Weblate```

text: Yes I don’t think that should go in the patch. Best to keep the official venue for bug reporting.

text: Ah, just realized it's `Msgid-Bugs`, as opposed to `Msgstr-Bugs`. Issues with `msgid` would indeed best be reported to Bugzilla.

elements.text: would indeed best be reported to Bugzilla.

text: yes :+1: but we added this email address to weblate so that folks without access to bugzilla can report issues with the source strings in a more user-friendly way

text: yep agreed... the idea is not every translator is necessarily using Weblate, so if they're reading the PO file from outside Weblate then bugzilla is the proper place to report. whereas Weblate users should be in "this" ecosystem (Weblate+R contributors slack)

elements.text: yep agreed... the idea is not every translator is necessarily using Weblate, so if they're reading the PO file from outside Weblate then bugzilla is the proper place to report. whereas Weblate users should be in "this" ecosystem (Weblate+R contributors slack)

text: Indeed, I wouldn't worry about it.

elements.text: Indeed, I wouldn't worry about it.

text: One thing I _did_ notice is cases where old `X-` metadata lingers around, e.g. `POOTLE` leaves an `X-POOTLE-MTIME`  marker, but when that file gets updated with Weblate, that field could be deleted but Weblate leaves it. Something to fix ourselves manually I think.

elements.text: marker, but when that file gets updated with Weblate, that field could be deleted but Weblate leaves it. Something to fix ourselves manually I think.

text:
<@U02HVUBA4QY> FYI, there seems to have been something funny with your translation process, lots of instances where `=%d` somehow wound up like `%%d`, which confuses the tooling, e.g.

<https://translate.rx.studio/translate/r-project/base-c/ca/?q=check%3Ac_format&offset=17>

text: ah, ok, but somehow Catalan does not show up in the “Checks / C format” problems page (see attached screen capture). We’ve done it for a fraction of them, and the plan is to do it through all of it.
